intro: Elettaria hemisphaerica, commonly known as the lesser cardamom, is a perennial herb native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its aromatic, finger-like rhizomes that are used in traditional medicine and cuisine. The plant typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. Its rhizomes contain essential oils and compounds that contribute to its distinctive spicy and sweet aroma. The botanical features of Elettaria hemisphaerica make it a valuable species in both horticulture and pharmacology.
